noun.description: A curved symmetrical structure spanning an opening and typically supporting the weight of a bridge, roof, or wall above it.

verb.description: Have the curved shape of an arch.
examples: a beautiful bridge that arched over a canal

adjective.description: Deliberately or affectedly playful and teasing.
examples: arch observations about even the most mundane matters

origin: Mid 17th century: from arch-, by association with the sense rogue in combinations such as arch-scoundrel.
